metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14051 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow in the qla2x00_sysfs_write_optrom_ctl function in drivers/scsi/qla2xxx/qla_attr.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.10 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and system crash) by leveraging root access. It was discovered that an integer overflow existed in the sysfs interface for the QLogic 24xx+ series SCSI driver in the Linux kernel. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-98.121

linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121').

linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
